description: Borrowed from Middle French ingénieux, from Old French engenious, from Latin ingeniōsus (“endowed with good natural capacity, gifted with genius”), from ingenium (“innate or natural quality, natural capacity, genius”), from in- (“in”) +‎ gignere (“to produce”), Old Latin genere. See also engine.

adjectives.description: ingenious (comparative more ingenious, superlative most ingenious)

entries.meaning: Of a person: Displaying genius or brilliance; inventive.
examples: This fellow is ingenious; he fixed a problem I didn’t even know I had.

entries.meaning: Of a thing: characterized by genius; cleverly contrived or done.
examples: That is an ingenious model of the atom.
Synonyms: adroit, keen, sagacious, shrewd; see also Thesaurus:witty
He sent me an ingenious reply to an email.
